questions.question: What structure separates the true pelvis from the false pelvis?
questions.explanation: The pelvic brim (linea terminalis) separates the false (greater) pelvis above from the true (lesser) pelvis below.

questions.question: Which nerve is most commonly injured during childbirth?
questions.explanation: The pudendal nerve can be compressed during childbirth, leading to temporary incontinence or perineal numbness.
